item.title: "Similar temporary fencing emblazoned with banners...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"Similar temporary fencing emblazoned with banners promising “brand new apartments coming soon” surrounded a nearby construction site."
----
The site was already clean- But for Denver's inhumane and cruel Mayor people are trash. Unless you donate to his election campaign... then he can be bought.

https://denverite.com/…/an-encampment-clean-up-in-curtis-p…/

Denver housing officials and homelessness service providers are seeing encampments grow amid the economic slowdown created by the pandemic.

denverite.com

An encampment clean-up in Curtis Park delayed by snow started Tuesday before sunrise

Denver housing officials and homelessness service providers are seeing encampments grow amid the economic slowdown created by the pandemic.Denver housing officials and homelessness service providers are seeing encampments grow amid the economic slowdown created by the pandemic.

item.title: The article is few months old (May) but there is no reason we...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

The article is few months old (May) but there is no reason we could not have had our own sanctioned tent encampments. We have connections with outreach workers in SF and they tell us that in the areas where they have created these encampment Sweeps just outside the camps have increased dramatically.

Even so, it is a far cry better than folks lined up along the sidewalks. Our Mayor would rather scatter our homeless and create controversy and free press by being mean. It is no...t helping but several dozen of these camps will help. If we would just do it. for all those "We can Do Better" folks why aren't you?
List your excuses below.

https://sf.curbed.com/…/tent-city-sf-san-francisco-coronavi…

See MoreWith more to come

sf.curbed.com

SF’s first sanctioned tent city provides safe—albeit temporary—shelter during pandemic

With more to comeWith more to come
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: Public hearing on Oct 12. Let us see if the real-estate lobby,...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Public hearing on Oct 12.
Let us see if the real-estate lobby, the ones who have tried to buy off council members, come out opposed. Council will need some backbone on this one to make the needed change. Because you know despite what he says publicly the Mayor will veto it so a super majority in council is needed. Even then they have flip-flopped after a Mayoral Veto in the past.
Remember the Denver Post Building vote?
Remember the amendments to last years budget?
Lets not get too excited here.

The Denver City Council is considering a temporary zoning amendment that would liberate land restricted under “old” zoning code for emergency uses, such as city-sanctioned homeless encampments and outdoor expansions

coloradopolitics.com

Denver clears path for zoning change that could free up land for managed homeless campsites

The Denver City Council is considering a temporary zoning amendment that would liberate land restricted under “old” zoning code for emergency uses, such as city-sanctioned homeless encampments and outdoor expansionsThe Denver City Council is considering a temporary zoning amendment that would liberate land restricted under “old” zoning code for emergency uses, such as city-sanctioned homeless encampments and outdoor expansions

item.title: Denver's Mayor is a an evil man. These folks have no where...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Denver's Mayor is a an evil man. These folks have no where to go. All options will look like this in the end, continually living in fear because they have no housing. They are imprisoned, shamed and more... all they wanted was a place that they could go.

Denver Homeless Out Loud was live.

item.title: From yesturdays homeless Advisory meeting. Folks mentioned who...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

From yesturdays homeless Advisory meeting. Folks mentioned who were planing on leaving today as posted were fenced in to the encampment at 3am this moring. How many trash cans coul be provided to the other camps around the city for the money they spent to fense these people in.

We challenged the maypr to do something humane in response to the demands of the folks at this camp. He escalated fachist style power over our moust vulnerable .... again.

We will have more of ...the homeless adviousry meeting that was held on Monday as we finnish processing the video

\https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5TZX1KcRUNo

item.title: Residents of Encampment at 25th and Arapahoe make Three Demands...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Residents of Encampment at 25th and Arapahoe make Three Demands of the City Before Sweep Set for Tuesday

Moving Support Needed On Tuesday: Please Come (see details below)

Residents of this encampment are demanding that City officials choice between the following options:

...

Provide housing or hotel rooms to all residents of this encampment (at least through winter...but then with permanent housing connection)

Open an SOS site in the area immediately where all residents of this encampment can stay

Let former residents of this encampment be (without sweeps and police) wherever reasonable spots they move to

Email mayorsoffice@denvergov.org and join the residents in making these demands!

Moving Support Needed

Please come to 25th and Arapahoe and Lawrence on Tuesday morning to help residents who are moving. Bring any or all of the following:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move

-Carts

-Bungee Cords

-Rope

-Trash Bags

-Food

-Coffee/CoCo

-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 7am and all morning help will likely be needed.

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: Residents of Encampment at 25th and Arapahoe make Three Demands...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Residents of Encampment at 25th and Arapahoe make Three Demands of the City Before Sweep Set for Tuesday

The City has rescheduled the sweep of 25th and Arapahoe/Lawrence for this Tuesday, September 22nd. Since in person school is scheduled to start at that location on September 28th, most residents of this encampment believe it might not be the best place to stay once school is in session. However, this does not mean the 60 or more residents of this camp can be expected to ju...st disappear with this sweep.

Residents of this encampment are demanding that City officials choice between the following options:

Provide housing or hotel rooms to all residents of this encampment (at least through winter...but then with permanent housing connection)

Open an SOS site in the area immediately where all residents of this encampment can stay

Let former residents of this encampment be (without sweeps and police) wherever reasonable spots they move to

The City should reply to residents with which option they are choosing by Monday (9/21) so residents know where they will be moving to on Tuesday. City officials can make this announcement directly delivered to the camp in writing, or send it to info@denverhomelessoutloud.org and we will deliver it to residents for the City.

If the City needs assistance finding housing or hotels for the roughly 60 residents of this encampment, they need look no farther than the thousands of vacant luxury apartments and hotels. The City can hold master leases on apartments and rent those to people according to their income. They can also set up long term leases at hotels as they move forward in buying vacant hotels.

Homelessness ends with a home. This is possible. The time is now. The residents of 25th and Arapahoe are waiting...

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: We were sent this -------- "I live on Logan Street, right...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

We were sent this
--------

"I live on Logan Street, right between 13th and 14th Ave and wanted to write and thank you for setting up port-a-potties in the area. Until then, our alley had become a public restroom, which was becoming very unsanitary and unsafe, not to mention really unpleasant. Since you all set up those restrooms, the situation has improved drastically, and we very much appreciate you doing what the city seems unable to do."
----

...

The portapotties we have put at a few of the camps. Unlikekthe city we cannot afford to sponsor but just a few encampments, But the efect is an example of how much just providing bathrooms and trash removal than help homeless neighbors exist peacefully with housed ones.

A much better option than scaring everyone by sending in people dressed in black with loaded guns. SPend that proposed 3% DPD raise on bathrooms.

This is but one example of what can happen when you treat people with dignity and respect.

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: What did I tell you about this guy. In every way posible he...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

What did I tell you about this guy. In every way posible he will do things not to have visible evidence of povety. He was not being honest with us when he said he supported SOS camps. Wait till the next site, he will oppose that one when it matters too.

Here he is back tracking as soon as the realestate lobby cries to him. Manipulated [bought] by real estate developers who came to 5-points in 2009 to invest. Just after the 2008 housing crisis to pick up some bargains and... gentrify. Hancock only responds to those who contribute large amounts of money to his campaign.

Yes it is that bad.
https://denverite.com/…/blair-caldwell-plaza-no-longer-und…/

See More“We are taking this option off the table,” said Mayor Hancock.

denverite.com

Blair-Caldwell plaza no longer under consideration for Denver’s first sanctioned camp for people experiencing homelessness

“We are taking this option off the table,” said Mayor Hancock.“We are taking this option off the table,” said Mayor Hancock.

item.title: "The mayor may have canceled his community conversations...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"The mayor may have canceled his community conversations about Safe Outdoor Space, but we haven't!"

For those who have some access issues.
We have some options, but you need to get a hold of us so we can works something out.
